title: BrainWorkup, LLC
text: Our clinical neuropsychology practice is committed to providing thorough, evidence-informed neuropsychological assessments for children and adolescents. Our expertise covers a broad spectrum, from ADHD to learning disabilities, ensuring your child receives the best care possible.

title: BrainWorkup, LLC
text:
Services Tailored for Developing Minds

In-depth Neuropsychological Evaluations: Dive deep into understanding your child’s cognitive landscape.
Targeted Consultation and Advice: Customized support for families and educators, fostering optimal growth.
Continued Care and Guidance: We’re here for the long haul, offering ongoing assistance to adapt to your child’s evolving needs.

title: Neuropsychological Services for Adults
text:
We can provide comprehensive ADHD evaluations for college students. We can also provide documentation for accommodations at your university.



We can provide comprehensive psychoeducational evaluations for college students relevant to MCAT, LSAT, GRE, and other standardized tests.



An initial consultation is scheduled to gather relevant background information. This is a good time to ask specific questions and address concerns you may have. We can provide the highest quality of service by working collaboratively with you. If further testing is warranted, a testing appointment will be made at that time.



The testing session may last from 2-8 hours, depending on the referral question, nature of the problem, and availability of previous testing results. Of course, you will be allowed to take breaks as needed.



Following the evaluation, a feedback session with you and your family may be conducted to discuss results and recommendations. With consent, other professionals involved in treatment may participate and/or receive information about the evaluation.



A comprehensive report will be provided to you and your family. The report will include background information, test results, diagnosis, and recommendations. The report can then be used to apply for testing accommodations.

title: Joey W. Trampush, Ph.D.
text: Dr. Trampush is the founder and chief neuropsychologist at Brainworkup, LLC. He is an Assistant Professor of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences at the Keck School of Medicine of USC and a practicing pediatric neuropsychologist with more than 20 years of experience in the field.

title: Joey W. Trampush, Ph.D.
text:
Background
My expertise lies in the intersection of neuropsychology and genetics.

Education

PhD in Clinical Neuropsychology (2010)

CUNY Graduate Center

MPhil in Clinical Neuropsychology (2008)

CUNY Graduate Center

MA in Clinical Neuropsychology (2007)

CUNY Queens College

BA in Psychology (2000)

Bowling Green State University




Specialization
My focus is on understanding how molecular genetics shape behavior and the risk for psychiatric illness. I employ tools based on open-source data science to delve into these complex interactions.


Clinical Expertise
As a clinician and developmental neuropsychologist, I specialize in evaluating cognitive, learning, and emotional difficulties. My goal is to provide diagnostic clarification for children and young adults, guiding them towards a better understanding of themselves and their capabilities.

title: Joey W. Trampush, Ph.D.
text:
Research and Interests

Molecular Genetics: Exploring the genetic underpinnings of behavior and mental health.
Neuropsychology: Delving into the cognitive aspects of mental health conditions.
Neurodevelopment: Understanding how the brain develops and changes from childhood into adulthood.
Data Science: Utilizing data-driven approaches to enrich our understanding of psychiatric conditions.

title: FAQ
text:
Our mission is to provide comprehensive, evidence-based neuropsychological assessments for children and adolescents. We specialize in diagnosing and offering recommendations for a variety of conditions including ADHD, learning disabilities, and more.




Comprehensive Neuropsychological Assessments: We offer detailed assessments to understand cognitive strengths and challenges.
Consultation and Recommendations: Personalized strategies and support for parents and educators.
Follow-up and Support: Ongoing support and follow-up services tailored to each child’s needs.

title: Forensic Neuropsychological Evaluation Services
text:
Forensic neuropsychological evaluations are critical in legal settings, blending the expertise of neuropsychology with legal requirements. With our extensive experience and qualifications in this field, clients are assured of comprehensive and ethical evaluations.





Forensic neuropsychology is a specialized branch of neuropsychology that applies its principles to legal matters.



It goes beyond general neuropsychology by focusing on issues such as competency and criminal responsibility.



These evaluations are essential in various legal contexts, aiding in decision-making processes.




We provide several types of evaluations, including competency evaluations and criminal responsibility assessments, following evidence-based practices and ethical guidelines.



Our services are beneficial to lawyers, courts, and insurance companies, providing essential insights in legal cases.





Potential clients can start with a consultation to understand their needs.



Our assessment process is thorough, tailored to each case.




We adhere to the highest standards of confidentiality and legal compliance in our practice.




For scheduling and more information, please contact us at (Contact).
